ch.iserver.ace.net
Interface SessionConnectionCallback

All Known Subinterfaces:
ConfigurableSession
All Known Implementing Classes:
SessionImpl
public interface SessionConnectionCallback

The SessionConnectionCallback interface is used by the network layer to communicate with the logic layer in session scope. The session controller itself will process the received information and forward the relevant (transformed) parts to the SessionCallback for consumption.

The SessionConnectionCallback is the place were the operational transformation aspects fit in. It is used in case of a joined session. For published sessions the mechanisms are totally different.

Thread Safety

The SessionConnectionCallback is not thread safe. Use proper synchronization when accessing the SessionConnectionCallback from multiple threads.
